models.name: first_principles
models.description: Breaking down complex problems into basic elements and reassembling them from the ground up
steps: Identify and define your current assumptions
Break down the problem into its fundamental principles
Create new solutions from scratch
Validate your solutions against the original problem
examples: SpaceX's approach to building reusable rockets

models.name: systems_thinking
models.description: Analyzing how parts of a system interrelate and how systems work over time and within larger systems
steps: Identify the system boundaries and components
Map the relationships between components
Identify feedback loops and system behaviors
Find leverage points for system intervention

models.name: occams_razor
models.description: Among competing hypotheses, the one with the fewest assumptions should be selected
steps: List all possible explanations
Identify the assumptions required for each explanation
Compare the number and complexity of assumptions
Select the explanation with fewest/simplest assumptions

models.name: bayes_theorem
models.description: A mathematical formula for determining conditional probability based on prior knowledge
steps: Identify your prior probability (initial belief)
Gather new evidence
Calculate how likely you would see this evidence given your belief
Update your belief based on the new evidence

models.name: second_order_thinking
models.description: Considering the consequences of the consequences of a decision
steps: Identify first-order consequences (immediate effects)
For each first-order consequence, identify second-order consequences
Continue to third-order and beyond if necessary
Evaluate the complete chain of consequences

models.name: inversion
models.description: Approaching problems backward by focusing on avoiding what you don't want
steps: Instead of thinking about success, define what would make this fail
Identify actions, behaviors, and conditions that lead to failure
Develop strategies to avoid these failure modes
Reframe your approach to eliminate obstacles to success

models.name: opportunity_cost
models.description: Evaluating what you give up to pursue a particular path
steps: Identify all available alternatives
Determine the value of the best alternative not chosen
Compare this value to your chosen option
Consider both tangible and intangible costs

models.name: thought_experiment
models.description: Using hypothetical scenarios to explore consequences of principles or systems
steps: Create a clearly defined hypothetical scenario
Apply relevant principles or systems to the scenario
Follow the logical consequences step by step
Extract insights applicable to real-world situations
